intro: Cynorkis oligadenia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed orchid, is a species of orchid native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal regions. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with a distinct three-lobed lip. Cynorkis oligadenia is a low-growing perennial, often found in coastal dunes and fynbos vegetation.
